Description: Black-topped pottery vase with small lip rim, exterior coated with red and blackened slip and well burnished.
Curator's comments: Published: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p. 21; pl. xxx.72d, reproduced as B72D in Petrie’s Corpus of Predynastic Pottery. A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo, Ravenna 1998, p.149 [43-45]. A.J. Spencer, Pottery in Predynastic Egypt in I. Freestone and D. Gaimster, Pottery in the Making: World ceramic traditions. British Museum Press, London (1997), p. 45 right Marked H.23 (a) on side in faded ink.
Condition: good: surface on one side damaged by salt.
